p:
R o measures the degree of COVID-19 contagion or infectiousness. R o represents the average number of people who will be infected by one infected individual. Zhang et al
46 estimated that the median and 95% confidence interval (CI) of R o were about 2.28 (2.06–2.52) for early outbreaks of COVID-19. This means that an infected person can transmit COVID-19 to an average of two to three other people. Various studies reported significant variations in R o using different datasets.
47, 48
